required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pain, Inflammation, and Cannabis in HIV
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Medical Cannabis on Pain and Inflammation in People Living With HIV

brief_summary.textblock: This study will test how research vouchers for medical cannabis use affects neuropathic pain, inflammation and adverse events in people living with HIV (PLWH) with neuropathic pain.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will test how research vouchers for medical cannabis use affects neuropathic pain in PLWH with neuropathic pain. PITCH is a 2-arm randomized trial in which 100 adult PLWH with neuropathic pain and medical cannabis certification in New York State are randomized 1:1 to 1) vouchers for high delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) capsules (4.3 mg THC/0.7 mg CBD soft-gel capsules), or 2) vouchers for high cannabidiol (CBD) capsules (0.2 mg THC/4.8 mg CBD soft-gel capsules). Over 14 weeks, participants will have 5 in-person visits and 15 web- or phone-based questionnaires. Data sources will be blood samples, questionnaires, and medical and pharmacy records.

primary_outcome.description: self-reported pain severity measured via the Brief Pain Interference (BPI) severity scale (1-10) with higher score indicating worse pain.

secondary_outcome.description: Tests levels of recent inflammation (panel of inflammatory markers) at two time points before starting medical cannabis and 14 weeks after starting medical cannabis. Reported in pg/mL
Repeated measure over 14 weeks Visual Analog Scale [VAS] (0-100) with higher number indicating better adherence.
HIV viral load measured at two time points (baseline and 14 weeks; copies/mL)
Repeated weekly over 14 weeks measured with Patient Health Questionnaire- 9 [PHQ-9] (0-27) with higher score indicating worse depression
Repeated weekly over 14 weeks measured with Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7 [GAD-7] (0-21) with higher score indicating worse anxiety

arm_group.arm_group_label: Research vouchers for high THC product
arm_group.description: Research vouchers for high THC soft-gel capsules

arm_group.arm_group_label: Research vouchers for high CBD product
arm_group.description: Research vouchers for high CBD soft-gel capsules

intervention.intervention_name: Research vouchers for high THC medical cannabis product
intervention.description: Randomization will be 1:1 to high THC or high CBD research vouchers. Participants will not be randomized to receive a specific medical cannabis product, but rather a specific voucher. Randomization will occur in blocks and will be stratified by history of cannabis use (use in the past 6 months; yes/no), symptoms of depression (moderate or severe [>15 on PHQ-9; yes/no]), and HIV viremia (undetectable viral load (VL); yes/no).
intervention.arm_group_label: Research vouchers for high THC product

intervention.intervention_name: Research vouchers for high CBD medical cannabis product
intervention.description: Randomization will be 1:1 to high THC or high CBD research vouchers. Participants will not be randomized to receive a specific medical cannabis product, but rather a specific voucher. Randomization will occur in blocks and will be stratified by history of cannabis use (use in the past 6 months; yes/no), symptoms of depression (moderate or severe [>15 on PHQ-9; yes/no]), and HIV viremia (undetectable VL; yes/no).
intervention.arm_group_label: Research vouchers for high CBD product

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >= 18 years old
- Diagnosis of HIV
- Fluency in English
- New certification for medical cannabis within 6 months
- ICD-10 diagnosis code for neuropathic pain, OR
- Neuropathic pain in problem list of electronic medical record, OR
- painDETECT questionnaire score >=19
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to provide informed consent
- Inability to complete 14 weeks of study visits
- Medical cannabis use within 30 days prior to enrollment
- Unique pain symptoms (e.g. multiple sclerosis, rheumatoid arthritis)
- Terminal illness
- Current or prior psychotic disorder
- Street cannabis, opioid, cocaine, or benzodiazepine use in the past 30 days
- Dispensed opioids of benzodiazepines within 60 days
- Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory use within 7 days prior to enrollment
- Steroid use within the past 14 days with duration of therapy >=21 days

overall_official.last_name: Deepika E Slawek, MD, MPH, MS
